alert.note: Alert for Warren (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 07 at 4:17PM EDT until October 07 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central and eastern New York, including the following counties, in east central New York, Warren. In eastern New York, Hamilton. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 417 PM EDT, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in the advisory area. This will cause small stream flooding. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up a half inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will continue to cause minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Warrensburg, Indian Lake, Speculator, Johnsburg, North Creek, Chestertown, Eagle Point Campground, Scaroon Manor Public Campground, Edwards Hill, Sodom, Holcombville, Bakers Mills, North River, Christian Hill, Wevertown, Byrnes Corners, Igerna, Riparius, Pottersville and Darrowsville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
